)

This function sets the log verbosity level of COS MODULE

Parameters:

[in] cmd - SET / GET

[in,out] module_verbosity_level_p - COS module verbosity level
[in,out] api_verbosity_level_p - COS API verbosity level
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_default_prio_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  port_log_id,
const sx_cos_priority_t  priority 
)

This function sets the port default priority value. Packet which arrives to 'port_log_id' port without a priority will be handled according to 'port_priority' value.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] port_log_id - logical port id
[in] priority - port priority [0..7 , default is 0]
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

SX_STATUS_MEMORY_ERROR error handling memory

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_tc_prio_map_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const sx_port_log_id_t  port_log_id,
const sx_cos_priority_t  priority,
const sx_cos_traffic_class_t  traffic_class 
)

This function adds or deletes a priority from a Traffic Class. When a priority is added to a TC , it is automatically re-mapped from its previous allocation. When a priority is deleted from a TC , it is reallocated according to default settings.

Each packet has an assign priority. The priority of the packet is mapped to one of eight traffic classes (egress queue) according to prio -> traffic class map Each packet is dequeued on the egress port based on its traffic class

Note: Multiple priorities can be mapped to a single TC. Default settings :

Priority 0 -> Traffic Class 0; Priority 1 -> Traffic Class 0; Priority 2 -> Traffic Class 1; Priority 3 -> Traffic Class 1 ; Priority 4 -> Traffic Class 2; Priority 5 -> Traffic Class 2; Priority 6 -> Traffic Class 3; Priority 7 -> Traffic Class 3;

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] cmd - Add/ Delete
[in] port_log_id - logical port id (egress port)
[in] priority - priority
[in] traffic_class - traffic class
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

SX_STATUS_MEMORY_ERROR error handling memory

SX_STATUS_CMD_ERROR if unsupported command is requested

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_tc_prio_map_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  port_log_id,
const sx_cos_priority_t  priority,
sx_cos_traffic_class_t *  traffic_class_p 
)

This function retrieves the Traffic class of a specific priority.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] port_log_id - logical port id
[in] priority - priority
[out] traffic_class_p - traffic class
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_trust_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  port_log_id,
const sx_cos_trust_level_t  trust_level 
)

This function sets the port trust level value. The Switch X assigns the user priority based on the following modes: Trust port user priority - ignore packets priority and assign priority based on the port configuration Trust packet user priority - tagged L2 packets are assigned with packets priority, untagged packets are assigned with port's priority Trust DSCP - IP packets are assigned with a priority based on the DSCP to UP mapping, Non IP packets are assigned with port's priority Trust both - IP packets are assigned with a priority based on the DSCP to UP mapping, else tagged L2 packets are assigned with packets priority, untagged packets are assigned with port's priority

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] port_log_id - logical port id
[in] trust_level - trust level [0 - trust port user priority, 1 - trust packet user priority , 2 - trust DSCP , 3 - trust both]
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

SX_STATUS_MEMORY_ERROR error handling memory

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_trust_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  port_log_id,
sx_cos_trust_level_t *  trust_level_p 
)

This function get the port trust level value.

Parameters:

[in] port_log_id - logical port id
[out] trust_level_p - trust level [0 - trust port , 1 - trust user priority , 2 - trust DSCP , 3 - trust both]

SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_buff_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
const sx_cos_timer_value_t  xof_timer_value,
const sx_cos_timer_value_t  xof_refresh,
const sx_cos_port_buff_params_t *  buffer_list_p 
)

This API Sets the Port's Buffer Management Control in the SDK.

Note: Buffers 0 - 7 allocation is under the below restrictions: On global pause mode, only a single buffer (buffer 1) can be configured. All traffic will go to buffer 1 Buffer 0 must be used for lossy traffic (no Pause should be used).

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] cmd - CMD SX_ACCESS_CMD_SET or SX_ACCESS_CMD_DELETE.
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[in] xof_timer_value - SX Pause frame: Pause timer.
[in] xof_refresh - send pause frame interval.
[out] buffer_list - Array of 8 buffer parameters structures.
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

SX_STATUS_CMD_UNSUPPORTED command is not supported

SX_STATUS_PARAM_EXCEEDS_RANGE if the total buffer sizes exceeds the max for this port

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_buff_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
sx_cos_timer_value_t *  xof_timer_value_p,
sx_cos_timer_value_t *  xof_refresh_p,
sx_cos_port_buff_size_t *  total_buffer_size_p,
sx_cos_port_buff_params_t *  buffer_list_p 
)

This API Retrieves the Port's Buffer Management Control from the SDK.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[out] xof_timer_value - Pause timer field.
[out] xof_refresh - send pause frame interval.
[out] total_buffer_size - Total packet buffer array available for the port..
[out] buffer_list - Array of 8 buffer parameters structures.
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_buff_map_set ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_access_cmd_t  cmd,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,
sx_cos_port_buff_t *  prio_to_buff_p 
)

This API Sets the Port's Priority to Buffer Map in the SDK.

Note: Untagged frames must use a buffer used by one of the prios. SwitchX can not allocate a buffer for untagged frames only.

Parameters:
[in] handle - SX-API handle
[in] cmd - access command SX_ACCESS_CMD_SET or SX_ACCESS_CMD_DELETE.
[in] log_port - Logical Port ID.
[in] prio_to_buff - Array of 8 buffers, this is the mapping between a priority and the buffer.
Returns:
SX_STATUS_SUCCESS if operation completes successfully

SX_STATUS_PARAM_ERROR if any input parameters is invalid

SX_STATUS_ERROR general error

SX_STATUS_CMD_UNSUPPORTED command is not supported

sx_status_t sx_api_cos_port_buff_map_get ( const sx_api_handle_t  handle,
const sx_port_log_id_t  log_port,

)
